channel.title: Launching a .jar from within another application
channel.description: So I am currently able to load a .jar from my cache with ease. Parsing and everything is done. The current problem is that once the .jar loads my client freezes. I was wondering how to initialize the .jar from the application on a new java process?

item.title: Launching a .jar from within another application
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:6, topic:463553”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=567056.msg4124129#msg4124129 date=1350175751]

runtime -> exec
[/quote]No?

on a new java process?

Does JarRunner does this?[/quote]It’s reflection… but I very much doubt the OP actually needs it to be on a new process (I see no reason you would, anyways), and just added that to try and clarify that he was trying to fully load a new jar.

It’s hard to fully understand what he means in the topic, but it sounds like what he means by ‘loading’ the jar at first is that he is extracting the actual file, and then he wants to run it (which is what the real term load would be used for). I’m not sure what he means by freeze, unless he just means there is no actual problem except figuring out the next step to run the jar (in which case, use the jar loader)

Read full topic
item.source: Launching a .jar from within another application

item.title: Launching a .jar from within another application

@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:5, topic:463553”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=567056.msg4124094#msg4124094 date=1350168981]
runtime -> exec
[/quote]No?[/quote]

[b]on a new java process?[/b]

Does JarRunner does this?

Read full topic

item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:4, topic:463553”]runtime -> exec[/quote]No?

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/deployment/jar/jarclassloader.html
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/deployment/jar/jarrunner.html
